nodes.bodyText: Better to rename isNodeWithSyntaxKindInList to isDuplicateQualifier

isNodeWithSyntaxKindInList is used / can be used in the places other than checking for duplicate qualifiers. Changing the name would be a problem in such scenario.
In fact in duplicate check we have "ERROR_DUPLICATE_QUALIFIER" in the next line. So keeping the name as it is, would not affect readability I think. WDYT?
We can say isDuplicate then. It's more intuitive.
Theres a qualifier validation at the start of this function. Can we handle this also in the same block?
I feel this check should be moved to createFuncDefOrMethodDecl  method.
yea it should be. This is a temporary workaround. whole block is removed when syncing to service-typing branch as the TODO above. Is it alright? or do we need to do that refactoring here also?
ack. should be fine
This is a semantic validation. We don't need to handle that in the parser.

Thing is isolatedFinalQualifiers can only have following possibilities.
empty, final, isolated, final isolated and isolated final. No duplicate scenarios.
When parsing isolated, final isolated had  to be anyway validated as we should let isolated to be part of the type descriptor.
Only missing validation scenario is isolated final. We can simply do that also in parser as all other scenarios are already filtered. It only adds 3 lines. Shall we keep?

Sorry, I was referring to the comment "Only final qualifier is allowed for non initialized module var declaration".
We don't need to do cross validation between qualifiers and the presence of the initializer, at the parser level - That usually is done at the semantic analyzer.
Noted, will add this validation. Thanks!
This method has become a bit too large. Shall we extract everything inside if (isModuleVar) {...} to a separate method?
Duplicate qualifier validation should happen in a single place IMO
Method name modifyTypedBindingPatternWithMissingQualifier suggests you are updating the node with a missing qualifier, but here the qualifier is isolated
Qualifier extraction part is common to this and the method above this one. Can extract to a common method.

Do we need to remove this? Can we use get() to retrieve and then set() to replace the original item?
Remove is a very expensive operation. It shifts all the trailing items by one. Lets try to minimize the usage of remove() in all the places
